intro: Lewisia kelloggii subsp. hutchisonii, commonly known as the Hutchison's Lewisia, is a perennial flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Montiaceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of fleshy, blue-green leaves. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in rock gardens and native plant landscapes.
